snippet: Civil rights lawyers say the treatment of Muslims in New York violates federal court guidelines and they will ask for an independent monitor to review compliance with the Handschu agreement.
abstract: Civil rights lawyers say treatment of Muslims in New York City violates Handschu agreement, federal court guidelines governing police investigations that intersect with political or religious activity; say they plan to ask for independent monitor to review police's compliance with accord.
lead_paragraph: Civil rights lawyers say the treatment of Muslims in New York violates federal court guidelines and they will ask for an independent monitor to review compliance with the Handschu agreement.

headline.seo: Police Department Flouts Surveillance Guidelines, Lawyers Say
headline.main: Lawyers Say Surveillance of Muslims Flouts Accord
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Say Surveillance Of Muslims Flouts Accord
